qas.question: Who did the Soviets send to North Korea?
Where did the conflict in South Korea begin?
What were the generals sent to North Korea collectively called?
When did the generals finalize their attack strategy?

context: <a0_0>Soviet generals<a0_0/> with extensive combat experience from the Second World War were sent to North Korea as <a2_0>the Soviet Advisory Group<a2_0/>. These generals completed the plans for the attack by <a3_0>May<a3_0/>. The original plans called for a skirmish to be initiated in the <a1_0>Ongjin Peninsula<a1_0/> on the west coast of Korea. The North Koreans would then launch a "counterattack" that would capture Seoul and encircle and destroy the South Korean army. The final stage would involve destroying South Korean government remnants, capturing the rest of South Korea, including the ports.
